meanings.definition: To make something seem more attractive or exciting than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She was glamorising her vacation photos on social media.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover was glamorising the celebrity's lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but laugh at how she was glamorising her cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The advertisement was glamorising the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent5: The movie was glamorising the life of a secret agent in a thrilling way.

meanings.definition: The action of making something appear glamorous or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The glamorising of the event attracted many attendees.
meanings.sent2: Her job in marketing involved a lot of glamorising.
meanings.sent3: The glamorising of the old car made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: The glamorising of the party venue transformed it into a fairy tale setting.
meanings.sent5: The glamorising of the fashion show made it a must-see event.
